abstract_summ: This manuscript explores the question of the seasonality of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 by reviewing 4 lines of evidence related to viral viability, transmission, ecological patterns, and observed epidemiology of coronavirus disease 2019 in the Southern Hemispheres' summer and early fall.In this perspective, we recommend universal masking of the US public during coronavirus disease 2019 due to the high contagiousness of severe acute respiratory syndrome-coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), viral shedding of viable SARS-CoV-2 from asymptomatic individuals, and the likely contribution of masking to core distancing public health strategies for curbing transmission.With this perspective, we give suggestions regarding a potential candidate for the rapid detection of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), as well as factors for the preparedness and response to the outbreak of the COVID-19.On 31 December, 2019, a cluster of 27 pneumonia cases of unknown etiology was reported by Chinese health authorities in Wuhan City (China) [ ]Abstract An outbreak infection with the novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has developed in Wuhan since December 2019.This paper describes the first critical case in Gansu China.In this pediatric perspectives article, we discuss current limits in the understanding of novel coronavirus infection.
title_summ: Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 Infection in Children: The Dark Side of a Worldwide OutbreakWorld Heart Federation Briefing on Prevention: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Low-Income CountriesA Sever case of of SARS-CoV-2 infection in GansuForty years with coronaviruses2019 Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Paving the Road for Rapid Detection and Point-of-Care DiagnosticsOutbreak of Novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2): First Evidences From International Scientific Literature and Pending QuestionsThe Time for Universal Masking of the Public for Coronavirus Disease 2019 Is NowSARS Coronavirus ReduxIndoor Air Quality and Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)Emerging prophylaxis strategies against COVID-19.Will Coronavirus Disease 2019 Become Seasonal?Novel Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19): new challenges and new responsibilities in developing countries.Coronavirus Disease 2019: Implications of Emerging Infections for Transplantation.
title_abstract_phrases: Will Coronavirus Disease 2019 Become Seasonal?This manuscript explores the question of the seasonality of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 by reviewing 4 lines of evidence related to viral viability, transmission, ecological patterns, and observed epidemiology of coronavirus disease 2019 in the Southern Hemispheres' summer and early fall.This viewpoint summarizes some of the major findings in coronavirus research made before the SARS epidemic and how they inform current research on the newly emerged SARS-CoV-2.2019 Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Paving the Road for Rapid Detection and Point-of-Care DiagnosticsWe believe a point-of-care (PoC) device for the rapid detection of the 2019 novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) is crucial and urgently needed.Novel Coronavirus Disease 2019 Infection in Children: The Dark Side of a Worldwide OutbreakIn this pediatric perspectives article, we discuss current limits in the understanding of novel coronavirus infection.World Heart Federation Briefing on Prevention: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Low-Income CountriesIn December 2019, the novel coronavirus Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) outbreak started in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei province in China.SARS Coronavirus ReduxAs an atypical pneumonia began to appear in December 2019, Zhou et al. worked with remarkable speed to identify the associated virus, determine its relationship to animal viruses, and evaluate factors conferring infection susceptibility and resistance.
